page.title: 19Media-In the news
page.content:
{Picnic Sites Hit By Water Scare Stanley's top tourist attractions have been hit by a spreading pollution menace which poses a health risk to visitors.This summer,families visiting the Causey Arch,Causey Mill and Beamish Burn sites will be warned not to bathe in or to drink from the stream which flows through all three sites before passing Beamish Museum.The alert follows investigations by analysts which reveals the stream is a potential health hazard.Councils believe the source of the pollution to be the East Tanfield sewage treatment works but this was disputed by the water works.
{A media report by several pupils from {East Stanley Primary School. { }
